### Dr. Murat Karakus

Murat Karakus received a B.S. degree in Mathematics from Suleyman Demirel University, Türkiye, in 2009, and the M.S. degree in Computer Science and Information Systems from the University of Michigan-Flint, USA, in 2013, and the Ph.D. degree in the Computer Science from Purdue School of Science in Indianapolis, USA, in 2018. He is currently working as an Associate Professor at the Department of Software Engineering at Ankara University in Türkiye. He is the recipient of the Best Paper Award at ACM SIGITE 2011 conference. He has 50+ peer-reviewed publications and serves as a reviewer for esteemed IEEE, ACM, and Elsevier journals and conferences. His current research interests include next-generation network architectures, such as Software-Defined Networking (SDN), Blockchain technology, NLP, network scalability, QoS, and routing. He has led various research and industry projects.
:::

### Dr. Rukiye Savran Kiziltepe

Dr. Rukiye Savran Kiziltepe received her B.S. degree in Computer Education and Instructional Technology from Hacettepe University, Türkiye, in 2014, followed by an M.S. in Advanced Computer Science (2017) and a Ph.D. in Computer Science (2022) from the University of Essex, UK. Her doctoral research focused on "Spatiotemporal features and deep learning methods for video classification". Currently, she is a faculty member in the Department of Software Engineering at Karadeniz Technical University, Türkiye. Dr. Savran Kiziltepe's research interests span Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Computer Vision, and Natural Language Processing, with a particular focus on Turkish language processing and sentiment analysis. She actively contributes to interdisciplinary AI research projects, combining theoretical knowledge with practical applications in these fields.

### Dr. Ercan Ezin

Dr. Ercan Ezin recently completed his Ph.D. in Context-Aware Recommender Systems from the University of Bristol in May 2024. He holds an MSc in Advanced Computer Science from the University of Essex, UK, and dual bachelor's degrees in Computer Education and Instructional Technologies and Software Engineering from Bahçeşehir University, Türkiye. Dr. Ezin's research focuses on AI and machine learning, particularly in Context-Aware Next-POI Recommendations and, more recently, Natural Language Processing. With extensive experience as an AI Researcher and Teaching Assistant at the University of Bristol, he has published papers in top-tier conferences on recommender systems and is actively involved in NLP projects. Dr. Ezin's industry background includes roles as a Java Software Developer, Data Scientist, and IT Director, bringing a blend of academic expertise and practical software development skills to his work in both Recommender Systems and Natural Language Processing. Dr. Ezin has been appointed as a tenured faculty member at Harran University, Türkiye.
